greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = -(-1)^n * n^2.
comment: This sequence is the denominator of ((pi)^2)/12 = 1/1-1/4+1/9-1/16+1/25-1/36+... - _Mohammad K. Azarian_, Dec 29 2011

Also, circulant determinant of [1,2,...,n,n-1,...,1], i.e., determinant of the (2n-1) X (2n-1) matrix which has this as first row (and also first column), where row k+1 is obtained by cyclically shifting row k one place to the left. - _M. F. Hasler_, Dec 17 2016
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (-3,-3,-1).
formula: a(n) is multiplicative with a(2^e) = -(4^e) if e>0, a(p^e) = (p^2)^e if p>2.
a(n) = a(-n) = -(-1)^n * A000290(n) for all n in Z.
xref: For the reversion of this sequence see A263843 (and also A007297).
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Jul 02 2009
